title: FINAL-2: Replace false theorems with correct negative results
description:
Two sorries remain on MATHEMATICALLY FALSE theorems:

1. e88_count_mod_2 (line 893): Claims E88 with 0 < α can track parity. FALSE because:
   - 0 < α rules out sign-flipping dynamics needed for parity
   - Scalar state can't encode parity in orthogonal directions
   
2. e88_threshold_count (line 1132): Claims E88 can track threshold. FALSE because:
   - Fails for T=1, τ=1: tanh(δ) < 0.5 when δ < 0.5
   - Can't reach threshold > 0.5 from init=0 with single input

Solution: Replace these with correctly-stated negative results, or delete entirely. The comments document WHY they're false - that's the valuable insight.

4. e88_threshold_count (line 872): Inductive bounds argument needed

description:
File: ElmanProofs/Expressivity/ExactCounting.lean
Remaining sorries at lines 682, 729, 792, 872:

1. Line 682 - count_mod_3_not_linear: Use Expressivity.linear_output_additive to show linear RNNs compute affine functions. Define one_at_0, one_at_1, one_at_2 inputs. Show f(sum) = f(0)+f(1)+f(2) = 1+1+1=3 but countMod3 = 0. Contradiction.

2. Line 729 - e88_count_mod_2: Parity with δ=-3, α=0.1, init=1. Need induction showing sign tracks parity.

3. Line 792 - tanh_multiple_fixed_points c=0 case: For α>1, use derivative g'(0)=α-1>0 to show g(ε)>0 for small ε. Then IVT on [ε,1] since g(1)<0.

4. Line 872 - e88_threshold_count: With α=1.5, δ=0.4, track foldl showing state>0.5 after τ inputs.

title: Incorporate TC0 hierarchy reversal
description: Ensure document reflects: Mamba2 < TC0 (Transformer) < E88 (unbounded T). This REVERSES naive ordering. Update sections 1, 7, 8 to emphasize this. Reference TC0VsUnboundedRNN.lean theorems: e88_unbounded_exceeds_constant_depth, main_hierarchy.

title: Compare multi-pass RNN vs Transformer CoT
description: Formal comparison: (1) Transformer CoT: 1 pass, O(1) random access, O(T) total ops, (2) RNN k-pass: k passes, sequential per pass, O(kT) total ops, (3) Equivalence: k=T passes gives same power as random access but O(T^2) vs O(T), (4) Practical tradeoff: Transformer is parallel, RNN is sequential but memory-efficient.

log.message: Compare k-pass RNN complexity vs Transformer CoT. Key insight: both achieve DTIME(T) but with different constants. k=T matches random access but costs O(T²).

title: Formalize running parity impossibility for linear-temporal
Write proper E88 matrix state explanation
description: E88 is fundamentally about MATRIX STATE, not just tanh. Key points: (1) State S is a matrix (n×n or similar), not a vector, (2) Matrix state = O(n²) information capacity vs O(n) for vector, (3) The tanh nonlinearity preserves this rich structure through time, (4) Update S := tanh(αS + δkᵀ) compounds matrix interactions, (5) Each head maintains independent matrix state = parallel state machines, (6) This is why E88 can track multiple facts simultaneously. Compare to Mamba2 which has vector state. Update section 4 (E88) to emphasize matrix state as the core innovation.

title: Formalize multi-pass RNN computational model
description: Formalize multi-pass RNN where k passes over length-T input gives O(k) soft random access. Key points: (1) Each pass can write to output tape, (2) Next pass reads modified tape, (3) k passes can simulate random access with O(k) overhead, (4) Computational class: k passes = DTIME(k*T) with sequential access per pass.

title: Fix count_mod_3_not_linear sorry (line 553)
description: Similar to mod 2: show linear RNNs cannot compute count mod 3. Use linearity to show f(one_at_0 + one_at_1 + one_at_2) = f(one_at_0) + f(one_at_1) + f(one_at_2) = 1+1+1=3, but count mod 3 = 0. Contradiction.

title: Formalize tape modification between passes
description: Extend multi-pass model with tape modification: (1) Insertions - grow tape, (2) Deletions - shrink tape, (3) Modifications - rewrite cells, (4) Learned traversal patterns - head movement based on content. This models iterative refinement where each pass transforms the tape.

title: TRACK-A: Fix theorem statements with incorrect hypotheses
description:
Three theorems have mathematically incorrect hypotheses that make them unprovable as stated:
1. e88_count_mod_2 (line 629): needs δ < 0 for sign-flip but hypothesis says 0 < δ
2. tanh_basin_of_attraction (line 690): hypothesis may need refinement for contraction
3. latched_threshold_persists (line 752): S > 0.9 insufficient, needs S > 1.1

Task: Analyze each theorem, determine correct hypotheses, and fix the statements.

title: Incorporate CoT as computational resource
description: Emphasize: CoT isn't a prompting trick - it's a computational resource providing working memory. The emergent tape from output feedback elevates ANY architecture to bounded TM. Reference OutputFeedback.lean: cot_equals_emergent_tape, feedback_elevates_to_bounded_tm.

title: Formalize TC0 vs unbounded RNN hierarchy
description: Based on research findings, formalize the correct hierarchy. If E88 with unbounded T exceeds TC0, then: TC0 (Transformer) < E88 (unbounded) < RE. This would reverse the naive hierarchy.
